The service PRECISE will be based on the system developed in the pre-operational project UERRA
(called UERRA system from now on) in the first two years. Moreover, PRECISE relies on the well
established collaboration between the contractor and all subcontractors. Both facts enable PRECISE
to deliver a RRA for Europe almost from the onset of the service. Operational updates in near real
time can be expected from the UERRA system already in 2017 if the service starts in April 2017. In
combination with the RRA produced already in the UERRA project, PRECISE offers a consistent RRA
from 1961 to near real time.


C3S 322 Lot1 consists of 5 work packages. The project coordinators are Per Unden and Semjon Schimanke, SMHI, with support of 3 principle investigators leading the work packages. 

== WP0: Management and implementation (lead: Semjon Schimanke, SMHI) ==
 1. Service management
 1. Monitoring the progress of the service
 1. Collaboration with other reanalysis activities
 1. Reporting to ECMWF
 1. Risk management


== WP1: System development (lead: Martin Ridal, SMHI) ==
 1. Design, implementation, testing and optimisation of the RRA system
  * Configuration of the ALADIN 5.5 km model with 90-100 levels.
  * Configuration of the ALADIN 3D-VAR at 5.5 km, background statistics, Jk statistics and tuning
  * Check and ensure correct observation operators for historical satellite data.
  * Evaluate and tune the use of satellite radiances.
  * Investigate what other non-conventional observations that can be used, e.g. Atmospheric Motion Vectors (AMV), ground based GNSS, GNSS radio occultation observations.
  * Configuring and optimising the surface and soil analysis.
  * Configure and develop SST and sea ice analysis.
  * Optimising SURFEX for our application and maturity of SURFEX options.
  * Develop and configure the ensemble data assimilation system for uncertainties and background error.
 1. Handling of input observations, e.g. selection rules, QC, bias adjustment
  * Adapting the observation input stream software to extract data and flags from ECMWF.
  * Implement black listing of historical data from ECMWF blacklist file.
  * Testing and adapting variational bias correction software for historical satellite instruments
 1. Handling of RRA output, e.g. quality checks, post-processing, converting of data formats
  * Diagnostic software to detect either missing parameters or unexpected extreme values.
  * Observation monitoring.
  * Post-processing and extraction of fields for archiving.


== WP2: Input Data Handling (lead: Patrick Le Moigne, Météo-France) ==
 1. Preparation of observation input data for upper-air (UA) analysis
 1. Preparation of observation input data for surface analysis
 1. Preparation of lateral boundary input data
 1. Tests performed with input datasets

== WP3: Re-analysis Production (lead: Lars Berggren, SMHI ) ==
 1. Production of a reanalysis for 2016 through September 2017 using the existing UERRA/HARMONIE system.
 1. Production of operational updates of RRA products based on the existing UERRA/HARMONIE system.
 1. Production of a reanalysis using the PRECISE system.
 1. Operational updates of RRA products based on the developed PRECISE system.
 1. System performance monitoring, fault detection and problem solving
 1. Quality assurance based on diagnostics, post-processing, output data management and the delivery of data.


== WP4: User Guidance and Support (lead: Semjon Schimanke, SMHI) ==
 1. Product documentations for users
 1. Training material
 1. Technical support
